Hey boneheadmx, just letting you know that I'm trying to get the economics and intro to economics books deleted, but I'm putting a link to [[Political Economy]] on the [[Wikibooks:Economics bookshelf]]. [[User:Paul Lynch|DettoAltrimenti]] 17:55, 18 December 2005 (UTC)
The politcal economy module is starting to look pretty good. Let me know if you need any help with it. [[User:Paul Lynch|DettoAltrimenti]] 18:50, 20 December 2005 (UTC)
Unfortunately I don't know much about political economics- actually before I looked it up, I didn't really know what it was. If you'd like to help me out, my plans are pretty much to get rid of these books: [[Microeconomics]], [[Macroeconomics]], [[Introduction to Economics]], and [[Principles of Economics]], and consolidate them into 4 new books: [[Principles of Microeconomics]], [[Principles of Macroeconomics]], [[Microeconomic Theory]] and [[Macroeconomic Theory]]. These 4 books correspond to the 4 most common college economics classes. Before moving any material around, though, I'd like to create some kind of skeleton for the books, and decide exactly what should be included in each book. Apart from that, I'd like to categorize different aspects of economics, and decide which subjects should get an entire book, and which subjects should be included in one book. My ongoing "list" of economic subjects can be foud here: http://dettoaltrimenti.pbwiki.com/FrontPage Any feedback on my list would be greatly appreciated. Thanks, [[User:Paul Lynch|DettoAltrimenti]] 20:58, 20 December 2005 (UTC)
The cover and contents looks good! You seem to have a knack for knowing the order in which topics should go in a book. Before the new year, I'm going to try and start the 'principles of macroeconomics' book, and pull the information for macroeconomics, intro to economics, and principles of economics. I would really appreciate any help putting the TOC in order and making sure I'm covering all the topics I need to. [[User:Paul Lynch|DettoAltrimenti]] 18:55, 21 December 2005 (UTC)
hey how do you put the template things you have in your wikipedia profile. like the this person is a drummer thing? --[[User:Nemo The Pyro|Nemo The Pyro]] 01:20, 16 May 2006 (UTC)
So....i just copy paste? or get the code from the source...? Sorry, im usually goo dwith computers but this doesnt make sense...oh and btw, how do i sign up for classes? --[[User:Nemo The Pyro|Nemo The Pyro]] 05:04, 17 May 2006 (UTC)
Uh huh okay i got that...what about for wikipedia? --[[User:Nemo The Pyro|Nemo The Pyro]] 04:59, 18 May 2006 (UTC)
Hi there, my name is Martin M. Elissetche. I'm a PhD student at the University of Maryland and the creator of a social science dictionary located at www.socialsciencedictionry.org. I wanted to know if I could place a copy of your book on my web site or whether you prefer if I just link to it. Please let me know what you think at info@socialsciencedictionary.org. Cheers, m.

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8 - 10|5 - 10 minutes preparation, must be frozen|1}}
A quick and tasty desert that's easy to make using simple ingredients.
==Ingredients== *8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (225g) [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] *8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (225g) [[Cookbook:Cream|whipped cream]] *1 ready-made [[Cookbook:Graham Cracker|Graham cracker]] crust (probably some product available specifically in the USA, based on something like a whole-wheat pie crust) *1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60ml) of unsweetened or unsweetened baking [[Cookbook:Cocoa|cocoa]] *1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60g) of [[Cookbook:Powdered sugar|powdered sugar]]
==Procedure== #Melt the cream cheese and the whipped cream into a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Stir in the remaining ingredients into the bowl. #Pour ingredients into the into ready-made crust #Cover and place in a refrigerator/freezer. Remove when solid. #Serve.
==Notes, tips and variations== *Fresh fruit, such as blueberries and cherries, make a nice addition. *Melted caramel makes a nice touch when dribbled on top. *Use fudge or melted chocolate bars in place of the cocoa.
[[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cream Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]
